emails.subject: RE: South Africa stats
emails.to: Lucas Rosa; Support Dnext; Iheb Mhamdi
emails.body_text:
Weekly imp-exp,...we should have as i am using in my tradeflow.

gg

 

From: Lucas Rosa <lucas.rosa@dnext.io> 
Sent: Monday, 2 June 2025 18:01
To: Guillaume Goudy <guillaume.goudy@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>; Iheb Mhamdi <iheb.mhamdi@dnext.io>
Subject: RE: South Africa stats

 

I think he is talking about those two.

 

 

Weekly Prod Deliveries <https://www.sagis.org.za/weekly_prod_deliveries.html>  & Weekly IMP-EXP <https://www.sagis.org.za/weekly_imp-exp.html> 

 

@Support Dnext <mailto:support@dnext.io>  how hard is to scrap those 2 data?

 

From: Guillaume Goudy <guillaume.goudy@dnext.io <mailto:guillaume.goudy@dnext.io> > 
Sent: segunda-feira, 2 de junho de 2025 12:32
To: Support Dnext <support@dnext.io <mailto:support@dnext.io> >; Lucas Rosa <lucas.rosa@dnext.io <mailto:lucas.rosa@dnext.io> >
Subject: FW: South Africa stats

 

Do we ?

Weekly trade data for sure. We use as lineupsfor the corn tradeflow. 

SAGIS deliveries...i think it is farmer selling/delivery. Lucas, did you extract this?

gg

 

From: Ruiz, Roberto <Roberto.Ruiz@mlp.com <mailto:Roberto.Ruiz@mlp.com> > 
Sent: Friday, 30 May 2025 17:41
To: Guillaume Goudy <guillaume.goudy@dnext.io <mailto:guillaume.goudy@dnext.io> >
Cc: THUL-Team <THUL-Team@mlp.com <mailto:THUL-Team@mlp.com> >
Subject: South Africa stats

 

Hello Gg,

 

I see in the dashboard SAF production estimates from SAGIS. Do you track also the weekly report from SAGIS on deliveries and trade stats? I couldn’t find a dataset with this data.

 

Thanks!
